intro: Campanula ramosissima var. velutina, commonly known as velvet bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It features upright stems that are covered in a dense, velvety pubescence, giving it its common name. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
